# DSMZ Order Template – Ocean’s Novem (Nov 2025)

Subject: Quote Request – 9 strains for open-source PFAS bioremediation project (Canada)

Dear DSMZ Team,

My name is Lyle Antoine, Dene researcher in St. John’s, Newfoundland, Canada.  
I am building an open-source 9-strain microbial cocktail (Ocean’s Novem) to degrade PFAS in soil and groundwater. The project is public on GitHub:  
https://github.com/yourusername/oceans-novem

We need the following strains (all Risk Group 1) shipped to Canada:

| # | Strain name                          | DSMZ number     | Qty |
|---|--------------------------------------|-----------------|-----|
| 1 | Pseudomonas sp.                      | DSM 1112        | 1   |
| 2 | Labrys portucalensis                 | DSM 25429       | 1   |
| 3 | Rhodococcus sp.                      | DSM 43338       | 1   |
| 5 | Desulfovibrio desulfuricans          | DSM 642         | 1   |
| 5 | Sulfurospirillum multivorans         | DSM 16171       | 1   |
| 6 | Azoarcus sp.                         | DSM 6898        | 1   |
| 7 | Phanerochaete chrysosporium          | DSM 1556        | 1   |
| 8 | Bacillus subtilis                    | DSM 10          | 1   |
| 9 | Methylocystis sp.                    | DSM 21370       | 1   |

Please send:
- Total price in EUR (including any academic/open-source discount)  
- Shipping cost & timeline to St. John’s, NL, Canada (A1C 5T6)  
- CFIA import paperwork you can provide  

We already have our CFIA import permit in progress (Directive D-12-02).

Mahsi cho / thank you in advance!  
Lyle Antoine  
54 Dene – Fort Simpson → St. John’s  
GitHub: @yourusername | Repo: oceans-novem
